00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements base List class.
00004 #
00005 package Parser::List;
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00008 
00009 $Parser::class->{List} = 'Parser::List';
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  First, check to see if we might be forming an interval
00013 #    (true if the close paren is not the right one for the
00014 #     open paren, or if one of the coordinates is infinity).
00015 #  If we aren't forming an interval,
00016 #    See if we need to form a matrix (entry type is already a vector)
00017 #    Otherwise if we have mixed entry types (type is unknown)
00018 #      Form a list if we can
00019 #      Otherwise report an appropriate error
00020 #  Then create the appropriately typed list object
00021 #
00022 sub new {
00023   my $self = shift;
00024   my $equation = shift; my $coords = shift;
00025   my $constant = shift; my $paren = shift;
00026   my $entryType = shift || $Value::Type{unknown};
00027   my $open = shift || ''; my $close = shift || '';
00028   my $context = $equation->{context};
00029   my $parens = $context->{parens};
00030 
00031   if ($paren && $close && $paren->{formInterval} && scalar(@{$coords}) == 2) {
00032     $paren = $parens->{interval}
00033       if $paren->{close} ne $close || $coords->[0]->{isInfinite} || $coords->[1]->{isInfinite};
00034   }
00035   my $type = Value::Type($paren->{type},scalar(@{$coords}),$entryType,
00036                                 list => 1, formMatrix => $paren->{formMatrix});
00037   if ($type->{name} ne 'Interval' && ($type->{name} ne 'Set' || $type->{length} != 0)) {
00038     if ($paren->{formMatrix} && $entryType->{formMatrix}) {$type->{name} = 'Matrix'}
00039     elsif ($entryType->{name} eq 'unknown') {
00040       if ($paren->{formList}) {$type->{name} = 'List'}
00041       elsif ($type->{name} eq 'Point') {
00042         $equation->Error("Entries in a Matrix must be of the same type and length")}
00043       else {$equation->Error(["Entries in a %s must be of the same type",$type->{name}])}
00044     }
00045   }
00046   $open = '' if $open eq 'start'; $close = '' if $close eq 'start';
00047   my $list = bless {
00048     coords => $coords, type => $type, open => $open, close => $close,
00049     paren => $paren, equation => $equation, isConstant => $constant
00050   }, $context->{lists}{$type->{name}}{class};
00051   $list->weaken;
00052 
00053   my $zero = 1;
00054   foreach my $x (@{$coords}) {$zero = 0, last unless $x->{isZero}}
00055   $list->{isZero} = 1 if $zero && scalar(@{$coords}) > 0;
00056 
00057   $list->_check;
00058 
00059 #  warn ">> $list->{type}{name} of $list->{type}{entryType}{name} of length $list->{type}{length}\n";
00060 
00061   if ($list->{isConstant} && $context->flag('reduceConstants')) {
00062     $type = $list->{type};
00063     $list = $list->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$list->eval]);
00064     $list->{type} = $type; $list->{open} = $open; $list->{close} = $close;
00065     $list->{value}->{open} = $open, $list->{value}->{close} = $close
00066       if ref($list->{value});
00067   }
00068   return $list;
00069 }
00070 
00071 sub canBeInUnion {
00072   my $self = shift;
00073   $self->length == 2 && $self->typeRef->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number' &&
00074     $self->{open} =~ m/^[\(\[]$/ && $self->{close} =~ m/^[\)\]]$/;
00075 }
00076 
00077 sub _check {}
00078 
00079 ##################################################
00080 
00081 #
00082 #  Evaluate all the entries in the list
00083 #    then process the results
00084 #
00085 sub eval {
00086   my $self = shift; my @p = ();
00087   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@p,$x->eval)}
00088   $self->_eval([@p]);
00089 }
00090 
00091 #
00092 #  Call the appropriate creation routine from Value.pm
00093 #  (Can be over-written by sub-classes)
00094 #
00095 sub _eval {
00096   my $self = shift;
00097   my $value = $self->Package($self->type)->new($self->context,@_);
00098   $value->{open} = $self->{open}; $value->{close} = $self->{close};
00099   return $value;
00100 }
00101 
00102 #
00103 #  Reduce all the entries in the list
00104 #  Mark the result as a zero or constant vector as appropriate
00105 #  Do any sub-class defined reductions.
00106 #
00107 sub reduce {
00108   my $self = shift;
00109   my $zero = 1; my $constant = 1;
00110   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {
00111     $x = $x->reduce;
00112     $zero = 0 unless $x->{isZero};
00113     $constant = 0 unless $x->{isConstant};
00114   }
00115   $self->{isZero} = 1 if $zero and scalar(@{$self->{coords}}) > 0;
00116   $self->{isConstant} = 1 if $constant;
00117   ## check matrix for being identity
00118   return $self->Item("Value")->new($self->{equation},[$self->eval]) if $constant;
00119   $self->_reduce;
00120 }
00121 #
00122 #  Stub for sub-classes.
00123 #
00124 sub _reduce {shift}
00125 
00126 #
00127 #  Substitute in each coordinate
00128 #  Mark the result as a zero or constant vector as appropriate
00129 #
00130 sub substitute {
00131   my $self = shift;
00132   my @coords = (); my $zero = 1; my $constant = 1;
00133   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {
00134     $x = $x->substitute;
00135     $zero = 0 unless $x->{isZero};
00136     $constant = 0 unless $x->{isConstant};
00137   }
00138   $self->{isZero} = 1 if $zero and scalar(@coords) > 0;
00139   $self->{isConstant} = 1 if $constant;
00140   ## check matrix for being identity
00141   return $self->Item("Value")->new($self->{equation},[$self->eval])
00142       if $constant && $self->{equation}{context}->flag('reduceConstants');
00143   return $self;
00144 }
00145 
00146 #
00147 #  Copy all the list entries as well as the list object.
00148 #
00149 sub copy {
00150   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00151   my $new = $self->SUPER::copy($equation);
00152   $new->{coords} = [];
00153   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@{$new->{coords}},$x->copy($equation))}
00154   return $new;
00155 }
00156 
00157 ##################################################
00158 
00159 #
00160 #  Return the coordinate array reference
00161 #
00162 sub coords {(shift)->{coords}}
00163 
00164 #
00165 #  Get the variables from all the coordinates
00166 #
00167 sub getVariables {
00168   my $self = shift; my $vars = {};
00169   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {$vars = {%{$vars},%{$x->getVariables}}}
00170   return $vars;
00171 }
00172 
00173 #
00174 #  Convert the list to a matrix with given open and close parens
00175 #  (Used my Matrix to convert the rows from points and vectors to
00176 #   matrices so they print properly.  Probably a mistake.)
00177 #
00178 sub makeMatrix {
00179   my $self = shift;
00180   my ($name,$open,$close) = @_;
00181   bless $self, $self->{equation}{context}{lists}{$name}{class};
00182   $self->{type}{name} = $name;
00183   $self->{open} = $open; $self->{close} = $close;
00184 }
00185 
00186 ##################################################
00187 #
00188 #  Generate the various output formats.
00189 #
00190 
00191 #
00192 #  Produce a string version.
00193 #
00194 sub string {
00195   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift; my @coords = ();
00196   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@coords,$x->string)}
00197   return $self->{open}.join(',',@coords).$self->{close};
00198 }
00199 
00200 #
00201 #  Produce TeX version.
00202 #
00203 #  Use stretchable open and close delimiters (quoting braces)
00204 #
00205 sub TeX {
00206   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift; my @coords = ();
00207   my ($open,$close) = ($self->{open},$self->{close});
00208   $open = '\{' if $open eq '{'; $close = '\}' if $close eq '}';
00209   $open  = '\left' .$open  if $open  ne '';
00210   $close = '\right'.$close if $close ne '';
00211   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@coords,$x->TeX)}
00212   return $open.join(',',@coords).$close unless $self->{ColumnVector};
00213   '\left[\begin{array}{c}'.join('\cr'."\n",@coords).'\cr\end{array}\right]';
00214 }
00215 
00216 #
00217 #  Produce perl version
00218 #
00219 sub perl {
00220   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift; my $matrix = shift;
00221   my $perl; my @p = ();
00222   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@p,$x->perl)}
00223   $perl = $self->Package($self->type).'->new('.join(',',@p).')';
00224   $perl = "(${perl})->with(open=>'$self->{open}',close=>'$self->{close}')"
00225     if $self->canBeInUnion ||
00226       ($self->type eq 'List' && $self->{open}.$self->{close} ne '()');
00227   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00228   return $perl;
00229 }
